item.name: Zeal Caster (1st Level)
entries: A zeal caster bears mechanical components to contain and recite the mystical cipher required to cast a single spell. Upon being fueled with the appropriate Zeal Fuel and any material compents (If the spell requires them). Casting the spell by activating the zeal caster requires the spell's normal casting time. Once the spell is cast the expended fuel and material components crumble to dust.If the casting is interrupted, the components are not lost.

If the user wishes to upcast the spell listed on the item, they must expend the appropriately leveled Zeal Fuel when activating the item. When casting a spell this way, you must make an ability check using your intelligence modifier or your spellcasting ability if you have one

entries.name: Age
entries: The chronological age of known synthetics ranges between five and twenty years old, however, their apparent or visible age has been known to range wildly. The maximum lifespan of synthetics remains a mystery; so far, synthetics have shown no signs of deterioration due to age.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Synthetics, unless given one during the fabrication of their soul, rarely have a defining personality early in their life, until they encounter events that would force them to adapt to such. Their alignment in this case ranges the entire spectrum and is far more likely to be dictated by their initial experiences than any strong argument, one way or another.

entries.name: Ancestral Legacy
entries: When you replace a race with this lineage, you keep the following elements of that race: any skill proficiencies you gained from it and any climbing, flying, or swimming speed you gained from it.
If you don't keep any of those elements or you choose this lineage at character creation, you gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

entries.name: Size
entries: You inherit the size of your original race when picking this lineage.

entries.name: Overdrive
entries: Once per turn before you make an attack on a single creature with a weapon or spell foci, you can expend a number of Hit Die up to and equal to your proficiency modifier. Upon hitting the target, you deal an additional {@damage 1d8} radiant damage for each Hit die burnt.

entries.name: Construct Arcana
entries: With an artificial body and soul, you are immune to magical ageing effects.

entries.name: Near-Perfect Replica
entries: When selecting feats and attuning to magic items, you count as the race specified in your chosen lineage.

entries.name: Empty Rest
entries: While you do not require sleep and cannot be magically put to sleep as other creatures would. You still require to rest for 8 hours, during such time you are inert and are considered unconscious.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other languages that you and your DM agree is appropriate for the character. If you are replacing your race with this lineage, you retain any languages you had and gain no new languages.
